scene_metadata.title: Rituals of Creation
scene_metadata.philosophical_depth: creation as ritual rather than product

dialogue.text: They might be rituals. Self-talk encoded as action. That's why you don't care if anyone sees them... but also secretly do.

psychological_notes: Personal projects as rituals reveals their true psychological function - not to produce outcomes but to process inner states. The paradox of not caring but secretly caring captures the complex relationship we have with our creations. They're private prayers that wouldn't mind being overheard.
philosophical_underpinning: Creation as spiritual practice transcends the need for external validation while remaining open to connection
therapeutic_direction: Understanding the ritual nature of personal projects removes productivity pressure
